content.detailedDescription:
At 11:35 pm i walked my two daughters to their cars outside my house after a party and we stood talking for a few minutes while rachel got in her car.  rachel, age 30, saw a very large shooting star to the west, then a brightly lit "cloud" above the same area to the west of our location at approximately 60 degrees from the horizon.  she pointed to the cloud and followed it heading north and said that it did not look like a normal cloud because it was glowing an amber color.  the full moon was out, the cloud ceiling was low and it was windy.  the scattered clouds were moving very fast. it was easy to see the sky, stars, moon, and clouds. 

at that point, at approximately 11:40 pm, maria and i both saw a large black round disk-shaped object that appeared to be on it side (top or bottom facing us).  the size was larger than a dessert plate held at arm's length. it was moving slowly from southeast to northwest along the bottom of the cloud ceiling, and moving slower than the clouds, which were clipping along at a fast pace. it was very windy.  the full moon shone brightly and i assume that is the only reason we could see the object.  there were no visible lights on the object. maria, age 32, saw this at the same time i did, but rachel did not, even though she was looking in the same area.  after a few seconds, the object changed to a gray color, then just vanished. the total time of the sighting was approximately 10-15 seconds. 

 i then said outloud  "we want to see evidence of any persons not of this world" and all of us looked in the same direction where the black object had been and i was pointing.  right after i said this a shooting star appeared in that same spot. we were all very excited at seeing this but commented that it must be a shooting star and just a coincidence that it happened right when i asked for a sign.  then we saw lots of shooting stars all around the sky (probably a meteor shower).  rachel left for home. 

maria got in her suburban to leave, and i headed into the house from the porch, but when i turned back to say goodbye i noticed a bunch (maybe 10) of tiny twinkling lights or orbs floating and moving around approximately 12" above the center of the hood of her vehicle, which appeared for approximately 4 seconds, then disappeared.  i was looking at this area trying to figure out what the tiny lights were when i noticed a reflection of a rectangular light on the car hood.  the light blinked on and off off.  

maria got out of the car and the light appeared again.  i soon figured out that it was blinking on and off every 25 seconds, so we knew it had to be something mechanical.  being square was odd, though.  so she turned off her car and i turned off all the lights in and outside the house in order to see if we could identify the source of the light.  it continued to blink on and off, being an amber color, white, or blue at different times.  there were two spots close together where the lights appeared.  we could not locate the source. we tried blocking the lights out with our hands, and checked the trees moving in the wind that might be blocking or unblocking lights.  the one light continued to blink off and on at regular intervals of 25 seconds. the only reflection of light on the hood that we could identify was the moon, which was in a different location from the blinking lights.  

then i realized something and said "omg" - and maria finished my sentence with "it's something we can't see and it's above us."  i ran inside and grabbed my video camera which i had charged up the night before and it went dead after 3 seconds.  maria got her sony digital camera out of the car and video-taped and took photos of the car and in the sky above us. note: the photos came out very dark and smudgy. i got the night vision monocular out but could see nothing.  i then saw a tiny orb appear inside maria's vehicle, then disappear.  i fully expected to see a ship hoovering right above us!  we could feel the presence of something. then, 45 minutes afterwe first noticed them, the lights stopped at approximately 1:35 am.
content.summary: Giant black ufo and unexplained lights over independence, mo.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving west on the 56 freeway after picking up my son from penosquitos around 6pm when i saw what looked like a very bright shooting star to my right (just north of the freeway).  it must have been a flare because it was just too bright to be a shooting star. i then saw 4 or 5 planes flying in the immediate area, which i thought was strange.  i have never seen so many planes in one area before flying so close.  i assumed that maybe it was a military exercise from the miramar base.  then, to the south of the freeway i saw a very bright and large triangle shaped object in the night sky that was lit up with two round very bright lights at the bottom of the triangle.  it seemed to be hovering and the lights would go out and then come back on.  i was not sure if the clouds were obscuring the lights to make it look like they went off or not.   my 4 year old son said he also saw it and confirmed that it was a triangle shape.  we went home and told my wife.  she wanted to see and so we then headed onto the 5 south freeway from del mar and headed south.  we then saw the same object to the west seemingly over the ocean with its lights sometimes going off and then back on.  it seemed to be moving south but i was not sure if it was just because it was very far out.  my wife noticed many planes in the same general area and we even had one plane fly very low from south to north-west over us while we were on the freeway.  it appeared to be military and not civilian based on the shape and the lights.  it was so low we could see the underbelly of the fuselage at night and many details.  we even noticed other cars pulled over to the side of the freeway with some people looking at this object and this activity in the sky.  thousands of san diegans must have seen this last night around 6 pm to 7 pm.  we then went to dinner.  not sure what all this was; i assume military but it did not look like anything i ahve ever seen before and i have lived in san diego since 1997 and worked/lived near miramar since 2004.
content.summary: Lighted triangle with two round lights at bottom hovering over del mar and pacific ocean last night around 6pm.

content.detailedDescription: I was in bed asleep and i woke up. i was still a little tired but i know i wasnt dreaming. the window was open and for some reson i looked out it i dont know why but i did. i was in almost a transe like state. when i looked out the window i saw a disk like object with six lights on what looked like the bottom. the lights were in two rows of three lights. im not sure how high in the sky it was.It seemed to move slowly and then dissapered with a flash.I dont remember if there were was any sound. i felt no fear at all more just wonder. once it disapered i snaped out of the trance and relized what i had just seen. i got out of bead and sketched what i saw amd wrote down the time. sadly i didnt get the exact date. after i wrote down what i saw i just went back to bead. i know, how weird is that. i was not afraid of this craft at all! i added a copy of the sketchi drew.
content.summary: Large craft high in the sky no sound disappeared with flash 6 lights on bottom oval shape.

content.detailedDescription:
Location unf campus 1 unf drive jacksonville florida

we had just punched out of work and left the building. i looked up and saw
a shiny chrome like object moving kind of slow and steady, like it wasn't in a hurry.  i asked my coworkers what they thought it was.  they said it was an airplane.  i looked harder at it.  it had no wings left, no vapor trail.  next i listened, there wasn't any sound.  i looked for rotors like a helicopter, it had none. the shape was perfect.  no lumps, bumps or protrusions .  the only way i can discribe it:  it looked like a big floating hot dog.  the top and bottom (the bun) was highly reflective like chrome.  the center (hot dog) was black in color. it was moving southward.
as i was observing this i caught sight of a second one traveling northward.  i hadn't seen it before.  it was moving at the same speed and altitude.  neither one seemed in a hurry.
it wasn't a jetliner (no wings) it wasn't a helicopter although it was  about the size of a chinook. (color was chrome like and the shape was too smooth.  it wasn't a blimp(too long and not fat like a blimp)
i have lived in jacksonville around 17 years. with 3 military bases here you see all kinds of aircraft. throw in the blimps and it is a pretty good number of aircraft. 
i watched the southern one till it disappeared behind a building. the whole thing lasted about 5 minutes.  my coworkers went on to their cars while i stood there watching.
the incident has bugged me for several days.  i looked on your websight to see if anyone else reported it.  nothing there.  but today i started going back in your list of past sightings.
surprisingly i found an almost identical event on 2/3/07  almost in the very same area where i work.
this encouraged me to write you and give you the details of my sighting.
i am not saying i saw a "flying saucer", for the life of me i cannot figure out what i did see.
content.summary: Saw two hot dog like objects in the sky. bun part highly reflective center was black.

content.detailedDescription:
I noticed an glowing orange light in the sky (dark night) whilst driving home with my daughter, it was to my right side so i asked my daughter if she could see what it was. she thought it may be a shooting star. i wondered if it was a comet initially. i made a right turn & parked so i could look at it. it was moving very slowly, no sound, as it moved across the sky i noticed  a kind of cone shaped dim light around the front of it, i can only describe it as the kind of effect that a search light gives in the sky, a faint glow.  the cone shape at one point tilted direction.  it passed over the sky from right to left. as it travelled further it was getting lower & looked as if it was heading for the ground, it went out of our line of vision. i fully expected an explosion but nothing happened. 

we both just watched as it travelled, at one point i thought to get my phone out to take a video, but  i wouldn't have had time to capture it. 

we couldn't work out what it could have been, i still have no explanation. i did feel that we had seen something very strange, and i still would like to know if there had been any other reports.
content.summary: Orange glowing sphere with a cone shaped glow.

content.detailedDescription: Steped outside living area in iraq to have a smoke. looked up and saw what i thought were stars that were a shade briter than normal. the 3 "stars" moved together as if connected. watched for about 1 or 2 minutes. lights were moving north towards baghdad. thought at first it was a uav ( unmanned fighter) or military aircraft. there was no sound, and no signal lights. jumped back into quaters and grabbed my nods ( night operating device/ night vision) looked up to see the faint outline of a traingle with the 3 light at the 3 points of the craft. craft looked to be 9-10000 feet high moving at 15-18 knots. there was no wind, and it was a clear night. craft then seemed to slip/ melt away into the sky. i am used to military aircraft, and this was not 1 of them. military base is located next to the city or ur, and the zigaruate, both mentioned in the first parts of the bible.
content.summary: Triangle shape ufo over military air base in iraq.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and i have 4 kids, a house and a dog. we are pretty average folks overall. so, imagine our suprise when we saw 2 ufo's moving incredibly fast one night.

on vacation in lincoln city, oregon, we were walking on the beach up to the casino at about 10pm. we hadn't been drinking, weren't tired and were looking forward to a late evening of entertainment without the kids. we walked up the stairs from the beach and were looking at the stars. i was pointing out a satellite to her and explaining it when 2 triangles flew directly overhead. 

the triangles each consisted of 3 solid dots of white light that would be covered by a nickle or quarter at arms length. they were four inches apart at the same perspective. 

these 2 objects moved extremely fast and silently in a south to north direction, following the coast-line. i would say we tracked them across 1/2 of the sky in about 2-3 seconds. beach fog covered the southern and northern horizons.

when we saw them we both looked at each other in stunned amazement and my wife said, "was that a...", and i said, "oh my god! i think that was a ufo". then she got very scared. i reassured her that everything was ok and asked her exactly what she saw. she desribed the objects exactly as i had seen them.

what amazes me about thes objects is the speed. they were so small and silent that they had to be at quite a distance, yet they moved accros the sky like a house fly in front of my face.

we went inside stunned, excited and more than a little shook up. i am a star gazer of sorts, have seen hundreds of shooting stars and this was no shooting star or meteor breaking up.

thanks.
content.summary: 2 small triangles flew extremely fast overhead.

content.detailedDescription:
one night in october of 08' i went out looking around a certain place that i have visited a few times prior to this.  i have gone to this place by myself and have caught some strange sounds also on film.  i'm not recommending that anyone else should do that but always bring somebody else with you, for safety!  

     this is a video capture from my video.  what you are seeing is what i would call for a lack of a better word an alien?!?  or just unknown?!  at the time of the incident i did have a friend with me.  we were just walking around the place i had my video camera and flashlight he just had a flashlight.  now i did not see this nor did he after reviewing the tape on the computer i noticed this "unknow" move behind the tree when i panned left to right with the video.  on the video you can clearly see this thing move from behing the tree and then back.  it almost looks like it has a self glow to it, if you will.  notice the shape of the eyes and there position.  also the head shape!  these are real and nothing fake about them!!!

     it did freak me out a little after i reviewd the tape but it was exciting to actualy think this could possible be an alien. i do believe that god in his infinite wisdom and creativity that we are not the only intellegent beings in this vast universe.  so, i am attaching a couple of pics from the video here.  hope all of you enjoy this if not well your entitled to it i guess lol.  thank you mufon for the website and to all of you out there searching and posting ufo sightings to here keep it up!
content.summary: Alien hidding behind a tree!

content.detailedDescription:
this is a copy of my original report, made on ufoinfo.Com - i think i submitted it the day after the sighting occurred:


"ufoinfo sighting form report

location: winchester, virginia

date: march 9th, 2008

time: 10:35 pm

number of witnesses: 1

number of objects: 1

shape of objects: spherical, star-like

weather conditions: clear, calm, 40's

description: i was on the porch of my home last night when i observed a yellowish-white star-like object. it was initially about 45 degrees above the horizon and moving toward my position from the northeast. we are under a major flight corridor here, and we see lots of commercial aircraft. in fact, there were several typical aircraft in the sky at the time - but this was definitely not one of them. it was larger and more brilliant than any of the stars in the sky. the color was very odd, similar to the "creamy yellow" of the holmes comet which appeared several months ago. altitude seemed very high, perhaps 30-40,000 feet. speed appeared slow, but at that altitude might have been around 200 mph or more. as it approached from the northeast on a straight line of flight, it reached a position about 75 degrees off the horizon when it instantaneously slowed to about half it's former speed, almost as if it was deciding where to go next. it then turned from it's southwest path and took a new heading directly to the west, resuming its former speed.

the most remarkable thing was that this did not seem to be a light that was attached to some object, but rather an entire object emitting light. after the object made it's turn and it began to move away from my position toward the west, the light it emitted seemed to "flicker" several times - ever so briefly appearing red/white, then returning to it's former coloration and intensity, which it maintained during the entire 3-4 minute sighting. i've never seen nor reported anything like this before."


   another similar sighting from woodbridge virginia, describing "four or five yellowish-white lights hovering low in the skyline, clustered together", was reported to the same source from an incident on march 5th/6th of this year.


   finally, a report was made on this site of an incident that occurred on december 7th near danville, virginia describing a "yellowish-white short streak in the sky" and a "very bright rod-shaped object" with a "yellowish-white radiance or cloud" surrounding it.

   i'm sure i saw another incident reported somewhere that described a yellowish-white object sighted near roanoke this summer, but i was unable to  relocate the information in order to reference it here.  


   but cmon . . . how many objects - of any kind - have you heard described as being "yellowish-white" in color ??  the color was the key, because it was so unusual that it attracted my attention to the object and caused me to observe it.  the bizarre angular movements were observed as a result.


   could it be that several complete strangers in the state of virginia are just coincidentally reporting odd aerial objects using such an unusual color descriptor as "yellowish-white" in 2008 ??  maybe 2009 will tell.

Was shoveling out snow out of my drive way with 2 friends. as i was shoveling the lights and electricity dimmed and a bright blue flash lit up the entire night sky. mind that the sky wzs pitch black because of the snow. me and my friends were wondering waht that was. we were in shock but got back to shoveling. in the next 2 minutes another bright blue flash came and it was brighter than the first. what followed next was creepy. best buy and other industrial business' poower went out. the block on my side of the rode lsot power. we went back into the house and found out that our appliances reseted. like the times reseted, but we had not lsot power. we went back out to check if the flash would happen again but it never did. very shociking experience. by the way not a power outage line breaking becuse this was direclty overhead and "travel" across the sky. this looked like the "wormhole" picture.
content.summary: 2 bright blue flashes.

content.detailedDescription: I have never researched this because i don't have an exact date. i must leave a 2 year cushion.  but sometime, probably during the summer months of 1960 or 1961 at midday, i was driving east on sunset blvd on the north side of the ucla campus. i came to the stop light at hilgard ave.  everyone at the light was craning their necks out their car windows and looking up at the sky.  i was driving a convertible, so i had an unobstructed view.  i looked up to see a circular mother ship stopped dead in the sky, hovering over ucla.  it filled the sky and my field of vision so it had to be over a 1000 ft. in diameter at a height of several thousand feet.  i cannot report any structural details, but i almost detected concentric circles on the underside of the craft, but i am not sure.  my instinct was to pull over and get a good look at it, but the light turned green and there was no parking lane on sunset blvd., so i drove away in frustration.  the experience was immediately dropped from my conscious mind, and i did not equate it with ufo's until years later.  in those days i did not take ufo's seriously.  i think i recall musing that there was no hope of communicating with them, and so there was no real urgency. their agenda was none of my business and beyond my comprehension, and there was no one to report the incident to. my guess is, it was monitoring some nulear activity on the ucla campus. the sighting remains vivid in my memory like where i was at kennedy's death announcement. a mental milestone.  if you can search by location and approximate time period i would greatly appreciate corroberation of this sighting.
content.summary: A circular mother ship parked over the ucla campus at a stop light at sunset blvd. and hilgard ave.  1000 ft in diameter.

content.detailedDescription: I was going out to my car to retrieve christmas gifts when i noticed two very intense bright multicolored lights to the southeast low on the horizon just above the tree tops in the distance.  at first i thought that they were airplanes, and immediately realized that they were not moving.  at this point i realized that there were no airplanes in the general vicinity.  i then thought that they were stars.  the objects were in close proximity to each other and were the brightest lights in the sky.  the lights were not flashing like the strobe, navigation, or beacon lights on an aircraft.  the were changing colors repeatedly from blue to orange to gold to red to pure white.  i realized that these were not airplanes, they were to low on the horizon and were not in the flight path of either airport.  additionally, i realized that the objects were approximately 1 to 1.5 miles from my location.  i decided to get a photograph of the object.  i was trying to get my camera out of my truck when i noticed that the object on the right (the smaller object) began to move away from the larger object.  the object began moving to the west at a very slow rate of speed.  the object moved a short distance and stopped and began to generate a tremendous amount of bright red light.  the larger object the began to get brighter and larger in the sky at the same time and was emiting large amounts of bright multicolored light.  as i was trying to photograph the object, the smaller object felw off at a hight rate of speed to the west.  it did not move away slowly, it moved from a dead stop to the speed of a shooting star.  as i was trying to photograph the object, it began to intensify in color.  i was able to obtain one photograph of the object due to the shutter speed and lack of ambiant light, there was approximately a 30 second exposure.  as i was attempting to obtain a second photograph, the object began to move.  the object moved in the same direction as the smaller object had moved.  the object decreased in size and turned a pale blue.  i lost sight of the object as it traveled behind trees across the street.  i then realized that i was hearing and seeing aircraft in the area.
content.summary: Bright multicolored objects.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and i were driving approx. 25 mph on a snowy city street in edina minnesota just one block north of hwy 494 (east/west)and one block east of hwy 100 (runs north/south). i looked up to my left and in the sky becasue of a very shiny reflection of something caught in the rays of the setting sun. i saw a large9 silvery shine almost a ball of shine with some red and my wife saw that is was a pyramid shaped object (not simply a triangle) with a red hued glow on the top and some blueish glow on the bottom and a heavy metallic shine reflecting from the sun. we were on a barely used side street and there were no other cars in either lane. i slowed but did not note speed because i kept my eyaes on theobject and the road but my wife stared only at the object. i am a resercher into these things but she is not and she said, " is that a parachute?...No..Is it a balloon of some sort?...No....Yikes thats a ...A ." and with sibelief because a believer.
 within the second from me looking to the road and then back up the the sky i locked ontot he object again and because the truck slowed i was able to see that the object was moving - floating in a southerly direction. it was at roughly the height of a plane taking off or landing and we are aware that the international airport is only about 8 miles from the sighting....But....
 after i had locked on the object for the second time and beheld it moving we both were staring at it as it ceased to me. it just stopped being where it was and was gone. 
 we scanned the sky and drove on but were unable to spot it from any angle. about an hour later, after we had stopped to get food and eaten, we got back on the road and were heading north on hwy 100. i spotted a passenger jet rising in the sky - obviously it had just left the airport a few moments earlier. it was clearly visable in the last rays of the setting sun and abou the same height as the object had been(but in a totally different local) we were then able to confirm that the object had to have been closer to cruising altitute than not, and roughlt the same size as the jet we were then seeing.
 
 today december 22 my wife saw the object again. ( i will make a report of this separately but will include it here as well briefly. my wife left work at 4:30, stopped at a grocery store and then called me at about 4:50 to say i can see it...I just say the thing again!  she whitnessed it on hwy 7 far west of the city over countryside just east of the town of st. bonifacious minnesota. it was closer to the tree line this time and she could clearly see that it was an elongated pyramid with the tip down. it had a redish glow on the top, a very shiny metalic reflection in the middel and a possible blueish hue or light on the bottom tip. she clearly watched it as it blinked out of existence. she is a serious scientist, a project manager is a high level position with many years of awareness (due to my interest) but nonbelief in this field. 
  today i have had three almost window rattling loud passes close tot he house by a helicopter but when i look to see the helicopter i can;t see any, this is not an exact assesment since i havn't asked neighbors if they saw it, or if they heard it, i havn't called to check local flight plans of aircraft or medical helicopters but i looked and looked and jsut coun't see anything. all of this has been accompanied by stress and dreams of a scary kind....Help 
i must also say that this is not the first time i have reported something to you. last year or earlier this year, we lived in another local and i reported a late night sighting of lights in the sky- but as stated in my report then..I could probably justify that those were maybe conventional. this was not conventional. 
 i am fascinated by all of this but equally scared to death of it. i do not want this and the fact that my wife has seen it scared me more because it has gone from "joe's little hobby" to "my god maybe this is really real!"

this was sighted yesterday- dec. 21 by wife and i, sighted today by wife closed and i have had three very loud and low helicopter passes over my home with no apparent helicopter in the sky- help.
content.summary: Pyramidal shaped object spotted floating with red and blue lights and metallic reflection.

content.detailedDescription: Me and another person left the house and were driving east bound on anaheim street. we saw bright blue object flying very fast up and down above us in the sky. it was flying over the houses that are next to the road. so we have pulled over to watch it. it was flying up and down really fast, than left to right, it kept disappearing and coming back. it changed color couple of times, from blue to green. we didn't have a chance to record it or grab a camera. this object was moving very fast and in a matter of minutes disappeared completely. there is no way this was a helicopter, this object was moving very fast, i have never seen anything like that. when i first saw it, person next to me pointed it out, i couldn't believe my eyes. i couldn't understand what it might be. i had an explanation in my head. i thought that it might have been one of those flying toys that kids play with these days. but it was way too fast. changing directions in a matter of split seconds. we even drove to a near by park to see if we can find some kids playing with anything, but it was dark in there, there was no one at the park. this object disappeared so fast. i don't know how it went away, all of a sudden it was gone. i am sorry but no pictures or video was taken. even if i was fast enough to grab a cell phone, i am not sure if i would be able to record anything, it was moving way too fast to even follow with my eyes. it kept changing colors, and disappearing.
content.summary: Ufo flying in the sky - blue and green color

content.detailedDescription:
This is second hand from a sighting that my cousins had on their farm in johnstown. (if accurate, is one of the most amazing sightings in colorado, but seems to be unknown. i don't know why this could be because it was high profile with official witnesses. maybe it was hushed up)

my cousin alan day, then about 14 years old, was sent out by his dad (frank day)in the day time to a storage shed to retrieve something. when he went outside he witnessed a triangular ufo above his property. this was in close proximity to an electrical power plant adjacent to the farm. the farm was south of johnstown a few miles.

when the father also saw the ufo, he called the sheriffs department, and an officer showed up quickly and also witnessed the craft. the craft then slowly began to move parallel to the ground and away from the area. the sheriff got in his car and tried to follow the craft along the highway but was unable as the craft picked up speed and left the area.

have you had any reports on this event? if so could you please contact me back. thank you.

james s. reynolds
content.summary: Triangular with a red light on each corner.

content.detailedDescription:
Traveling along route six in seekonk, children & i spotted a stationary red/amber star like light sitting in the horizon. my family & i know that many airliners come toward route six and either turn to go toward warwick and that sometimes the airliners head lights shine directly toward you when you view them, but this was different. it was different because this light did not turn, or change position, (when a plane does change position, it's headlights usually do not shine directly toward people observing) it just lingered in its spot & when we entered the store for brief shopping and came back out, it was still there. 

i watched it while i drove down route six and neared east providence & decided to see if we could find a better spot to observe, since the object did not look as high as a star & was low, perhaps lower than a plane, i wasnt sure, so curiosity got the better of me.

we turned around and headed toward wampanaug trail & tried to get on wamp. trl from route six & saw it above the tree line, not too close & not too far, i am figuring it was the level ground we were at, some higher spots than others caused it to look either higher in the sky or lower. as we were sitting in traffic at a red light, we observed two red, solid color points of light, which looked like the size of pin heads compared to the original object which was on the left. 

no blinking was made by any objects. one of the tiny red dots moved down & the other moved upward. very slowly. almost as if you could not notice.

curiousity got me even more & i drove the trail until we were able to get to riverside rhode island and we could tell now that the light we were observing was more toward over the water, but way too high to be a boat light.  it still remained stationary and as we were going down the street, we came toward a golf course on our right hand side and still could see the object beaming brightly. we could no longer see the additional solid pin size red lights.

driving some more we decided to go to sabins pt and check it out by the closest water edge and when we arrived, apparently, the sky was empty.

the whole time of viewing this object from the first notice of it, was approximately 45 minutes. the whole time of pursuing this object and trying to see it better and clearer and find its location was 25 minutes/ 30 minutes. 

if it were a plane, the headlights of a plane would have changed course within a minute or two, or even seconds. i felt as though the object was not ordinary and if it were, we wouldnt have had the curiousity to figure it out and just gone home.

i posted this sighting because there was another person who apparently reported seeing a red light seen in ma & i thought it helpful if i came forward to let them know that i had seen something quite similiar.

the time of event was about anywhere from 6-8pm (we didnt look at the time when it was seen) the date was exactly friday ( before the snow storm) december 19, 2008. no photos taken.

feeling? we were just curious.

happy holidays
content.summary: Red/amber star like sighting with two tiny red star like objects close to larger star like object.

content.detailedDescription: I had a little extra time today to experiment with some sky photos and captured a ufo in two separate frames within miliseconds. the three photos are in sequence from my front porch facing north. unfortunately the second photo is blurred, but you can still see the object. as you can see by the third photo, the ufo is missing. i have no idea how high the object is. most ufo activity seems to be in the afternoon after 2:00pm and before 5:00pm.
content.summary: Second day of taking random pictures of the sky.

content.detailedDescription: My family and i were sitting in a dark church parking lot waiting for 6:00 pm mass.  we were say 10 or 15 minutes early and were the only car in the lot so we waited for more cars to show up and then go in.  the eastern sky view was over the delaware river and there is virtually nothing in the background (no city lights ...)  then it looked like a shooting star the size of a jet airliner, however it was a neon green.  it streaked across the sky in a downward trajectory and then burnt out.  in the far distance (south - down river towards philadelphia) it looked as though a military hellicopter with a bright light spotted the incident and came towards us to investigate.  i say it was a military hellicopter because it was a very slow moving, large object with a very, very bright light.  it wasn't a bright star because it did kind of sit still, but then moved.  jets appear to move steady through the sky.  we all saw the second light sit still, then move in our direction.  anyway, other cars arrived and we went to church.  just wonder if anyone reported the came commet (ufo)?
content.summary: Bright neon green shooting star the size of a jet airliner.

content.detailedDescription:
At stop light thought that i was seeing the first star of the night. it was stationary. then it moved right at me. it traveled right at me then mad a right hand turn and dissappered in to the trees could not see a shape no becon lights to signal aircraft family of aviators not me, but know helocpters, jets, and planes. light was like a star i know a satllite could not make such an abrupt turn.  came from the west then went north 1- 2min duration on phone with wife she doesnt recall conversation, but when explaining what i was seeing in the sky she got very upset.
at light at gaskins rd and quaccison rd going west bound, on my way home from work(i am a respiratory theropist. i was very mixed with emotion.
 was just below the overcast sky only lost sight when veiw was obstructed by trees red light kept me from exploring it out more
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Cloudy sunset thought it was a star at first. total overcast.

content.detailedDescription: Looking north from the 202 highway just west of priest at 8:30 am saturday december 20,2008, i saw two small silver metalic objects, with round tops, flat black bottoms with no appendages. they attracted my attention as they were distinct in the sky and at a hight that made them stand out in the open sky. since they appeared to be distant (or small) i couldn't tell how high they actually were. at first i thought that they were hotair baloons, but there were no baskets or other appendages.They appeared to be at some distance north of camelback mountain and to the west. they were at the same hight and appeared stationary. i looked at them as best i could while driving. as i turned north i looked away and then after completing the turn i looked again as i thought i would have a better view looking directly at them and they were gone. my feelings were of curiosity. i have seen the phoenix lights and one other questionable object in the past, so i am more curious that affected.
content.summary: Two hot air balloon looking metallic objects, but no baskets.

content.detailedDescription:
I was returning home as i traveled north from silverdale along highway 3. (we had actually just finished christmas shopping for the day) about the time i passed the finn hill exit i noticed a very bright light in the sky. i thought it was a plane or a helicopter, as they are quite common.

me and my sisters were looking up at it, and i joked that it was a u.F.O. as we passed the southbound poulsbo exit, it began to look odder. it appeared to be more then one light, and it was completely stationary. while i cannot estimate it's exact position as it was night, it appeared to be over the hood canal bridge. if not over the bridge, as it was very far away and in the right direction.

it continued to remain stationary the rest of the drive. until i passed the hilltop gas station at the crossroads for tytler rd and nw pioneer way. it then seemed to slowly move eastward away from what was almost certainly the hood canal bridge's general area.

at this point it also became completely apparent it was three very bright yellowish lights. if they were connected they would make a triangle shape. it wasn't moving very fast, but definitely moving now and i was absolutely certain it was no longer stationary, and the size appeared very large. once i reached the four corners gas station at the crossroads of big valley rd. i noticed it had a dim, but rapidly flashing strobe between the two lights that framed the back of the triangle. the strobe flashed between red and green rapidly. like some kind of christmas rave dance. it wasn't too bright though and i was wondering if my eyes were deceiving me. at this point it disappeared behind the evergreen trees on my right, that is to the east.

this however wasn't my last sighting. i turned onto scenic drive and witnessed the object almost directly above us. it was moving at about 20 mph, and i was certain it was high in the air now as i drove past a very bright barnyard light i've seen illuminate helicopters before... and the lights were very far apart. if i held my arm out at it's maximum length, it would have been about the length of my thumb, about two and a half inches between the "front" and the "back".

this was the last i saw of the object, and the red/green alternating strobe light (which i will reiterate was flashing very fast.) was definite and my sisters saw it as well. i also thought i made out it's form against the night sky as a large dark triangle shape, with what looked like sharp edges (however i couldn't be certain because the tips of the triangle were where the lights were) i am not sure i actually saw the form though, i could have been just mentally connection the dots between the lights. i also rolled down my window so i could look at it without the windshield at this point as well.

it then sped up and moved out towards pope resources land to the east. even as it "sped" off, it never achieved a very fast speed, i don't think above a hundred miles per hour. that was the last i saw of it.

as a note, the picture i'm attaching has two small pictures on it. the larger one was my view of it when i first turned onto scenic drive, the smaller one was what it looked like about the time i was passing the poulsbo on-ramp. the picture was also drawn about 20 minutes after the event.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Triangle formation of lights with red/green strobe near poulsbo, wa.

content.detailedDescription:
There has recently been a severe winter storm in the portland, or area - snow, then freezing rain, then more snow.  there was no precipitation at the time of the event, but it was overcast.  i was in my bedroom browsing online.  my computer is near a west-facing window.  around 9:20 i saw a series of about 3 flashes of bright white light off in the distance, appearing to originate on the ground near the willamette river.  right after i saw that, the sky in that area went dark and i heard a distinct sharp and short electric buzz - i realized a transformer had blown.  a few minutes after that, i saw a bright flashing light from overhead  - it totally lit up the sky over our neighborhood and towards the north (directly south of portland).  this light pulsed regularly and changed colors randomly from red to blue to white to a strange green for approximately 3 minutes, then went out.  my son went outside during the event to see if another transformer was blowing out, but the source of the lights appeared to be in the clouds. we couldn't hear any emergency vehicles or helicopter/airplane that could explain the pulsing lights.
the location of the lights remained stationary during the entire event.
content.summary: Stationary flashing lights in cloudy sky - white, blue, red, green.

content.detailedDescription: Directly west of my parents house where i am visiting around 4 am friday night, the night before we had the snow storm the sky was very clear and all the stars could be seen. upon one of my trips to go smoke a cig, i looked to the sky as i normally do admiring how clear it was. i saw what looked like a star but much much brighter then normal. the star however would stay lit for a minute then go dimmer then come back with a red tint. normally i would pay no attention to this however no matter how i looked at it, it had a cross like appearance to the red light with the normal white light still seen behind it. off to the right of it there was another white orb but much smaller that appeared to move directly up, stop then move right. coming from the east of me was a small plane with what sounded like a propeller engine. it passed overhead and while i flew in that direction it appeared to get somewhat close to the first light which was still slowly blinking and alternating between white and red. when it appeared to get close i could hear the engine start screaming as if the throttle was maxed out and the plane veared south at a very fast rate as if running from it. the smaller orb moved in the direction of the plane and vanished. there were no sounds and it appeared as though these objects and including the plane were no more than 5 miles away as i could still clearly hear the planes engine. i went inside somewhat rattled not even wanting to think of what it may have been. i searched the internet seeing if maybe a planent could be seen that night but nothing. i searched maps looking for airports in that direction and still nothing. no lighthouses, nothing. i went out there again tonight at 3am on the 22nd after a large snow storm so no clouds at all were in the sky and all the stars could be seen. but looking, there is nothing in that area, that close to the horizon above the tree line. given how close to the horizon it was, i am sure it was not a star and definatly not a helicopter as the lights blink alot faster. also between changing from white to red there was about a 20-30 second period. i am not saying that it was definatly a ufo in the sence of a craft piloted by something other than human though i do not rule out the possibility. i just find it odd that i saw something where there should be nothing, and even saw a pilot react to this. the movement of the second orb was mostly odd because nothing should be able to be sitting still and then accelerate in mid air like that. being in the army and being around many different helicopters in my career, i know we dont use rotary wings that can perform like that. as a side note, the main light when red was brightest in the middle with the red, while it made points outward, up down left right, but the side points were shorter that the top and bottom. included is a cut-out from google maps. it is very possible that the area the lights were in, is further away than on map. another strange detail is when i went inside, my parents have three cats that normally sleep far away from each other and very loving of humans. these cats were awake, huddled togther in a corner next to the couch and acted as if very afraid
content.flightPath: Stationary,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Blinking star

content.detailedDescription: I work for animal control. on 12/21/2008 at approximately 11:00 pm, my wife and i had just responded to a house fire in columbus, in. we were on st. rd. 450w heading east bound back to hope. right after we had past a local winery, simmon's winery, i noticed to the north of us was suddenly a blue surging light. the light lite up the sky in a large area but the source of the light had to be on the ground. i pointed it out to my wife and she too observed it. immediately we started naming off the possibilities of what we were seeing. i mentioned that not far from that location is electric transformers in a fenced in area. i was certain that it was the transformers some how exploding. my wife suggested that we take a road in that direction to check it out. the best way i can describe the light is : it was blue and bright. it flashed very quickly or maybe a better way to describe it may be "surging". visualize a firework that they call a fountain that is set off on the ground and the glow that it makes around it. now visualize that glow and effect a quarter of a mile wide and lighting up the sky. thats what we had seen. as we drove around in the general area searching for the source we half expected to encounter emergency vehicles but we did not. it was as if we were the only ones who had observed it. when we got to the transformers there was nothing out of the ordinary about them. we continued to search the area trying to come up with an explanation. we did not see any other types of lights nor any smoke anywhere. we continued to take county roads circling the general area but we did not come up with any source nor explanation. what we seen could not have been over looked by anyone who would have seen it. it had us baffled. though we did not see any light in the sky nor did we see and object in the sky i could not get the thought out  of my head that it was possible extraterrestrial related. my wife laughed that idea off and refused to believe such a thing however she did admit repeatedly that it was a strange event and had no explanation for it. after searching for about 15 to 20 minutes we gave up the search and headed on home. the surging blue light on the ground lasted for approximately 15 to 20 seconds. (end of my report.)
content.summary: My wife and i observed a large blue surging flashing light on the ground that covered a large area.

content.detailedDescription:
1.  i was in my car and i was driving.
2.  large spot light shining across the sky above the road in front of me.
3.  helicopter w/ spot light, which was witnessed in the past in this area.
4.  very large.  filled the sky above my vehicle, just above the trees.
5.  disbelief at first.  stopped the vehicle, rolled down the window, looked up and looked around at its features and details.  frightening feelings once i realized i was alone.  now, a lot of confusion, wonder, but contentment.
6.  it continued on its path until out of sight above the trees.
content.summary: Extremely close encounter.  object filled the sky directly above me.

content.detailedDescription:
Driving southbound at 5:44pm,(we looked immediately at the time clock), on the new jersey garden state parkway at the newark, nj exits, both my wife and i saw a bright (shooting star?). it was seen through our windshield almost directly in front of us. it was approx. in the w/sw sky. it appeared and disappeared quickly. 3-4 seconds. we saw it at approx. 40-45 degrees above horizon and ended approx. 20-15 degrees above horizon. it was brighter than venus, which was bright tonight because of cold and clear skies,and it faded not entirely out, but disappeared at a lower radience, not at a dim light would have faded , say in a distance.
my first thought was that it was a shooting star, but two things did not ring true. one, the color was odd, blue/white as in an electic arc. similar to arc rod welding. secondly, i cannot for the life of me remember seeing a shooting star begin and end so abruptly, let alone beginning that close to the horizon.
content.summary: Arc blue shooting star descending very rapidly /40-20 degree angle.

content.detailedDescription: On december 13th, 2008 at around 11:15 pm (pacific coast time) in san francisco california, i was drinving with my girlfriend and my two friends sitting in the backseat. i was driving of the freeway and we were all pretty quiet listening to music with low volume. i was driving of the freeway looking at the road ahead of me. all of a sudden i saw an extremely bright light in the sky ahead of me all of a sudden shooting down diagonally extremely fast like around 20-30 degrees off of the horizon from where i was. to me it seemed like it was a white dot of light that all of a sudden popped out of the sky and immediately shot down towards the ground. i could not see where excatly it landed or anything because it shot down and went behind this hill hill in the distance. when i first saw it my first insticnt was that it was like maybe  firework but i quickly realized that it could not be because fireworks go up, then i thought maybe it was some sort of missle but i dont think that i would not have seem something as bright as that coming from higher up in the sky because i just saw it pop out of nowhere. then i started to think. after around 30 seconds i said "wait hold on.. did u guys see that???" and immediatelly my girlfriend said "yeah, what was it?" then i said "i dont know what did you see"  and according to her she saw a bright white line coming from the sky diagonally but she says she only saw it with her perifiral vision. i assume that it was a bright dot that was moving so fast that it seemed like a line coming down diaginally in a perfecly straight line. i knew that it could not be lightning because when i got out of the car i looked up at the sky and saw that it was a very clear night without a cloud in sight. also it could not have been lightning becuase it was way to bright. and also lightning comes down straight to the ground  but this came down diagonally  and in a straight line. i know that it was not a shooting star either becuase i have seen many and this was way brighter and bigger than a star and faster. after that we were all pretty scared and confused.
content.summary: A bright light shoot down from the sky diagonally

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting at the intersection of a residential road and a major commuter road and to my northwest direction, across the street above the woods in the sky was a ray of white light. out of this white light came a green, shining object. this object hurled, and sorta swooped down toward the ground like a meteor and had a bluish/white trail behind it like the tail of a comet. at one point, the object turned solid gray and i could make out a disc shape. what sent a chill down my spine was that i could see a reflection on the surface of the object. the tail soon diminished and the object turned green again and a white light opened in front of it. the object shot down into the light and completely disappeared. i actually thought the object had crashed into the woods, it was so low. this event only lasted twelve seconds and was witnessed by my friend in the passenger seat as well.
content.summary: Ufo exits wormhole then enters another.

content.detailedDescription: *i caught sight of the object while driving home from new windsor, n.Y. to newburgh.  very bright and looked to have blue strings of light forming a cone at the top and bottom of craft. it was bumper to bumper on 17k wich runs the length of stewart.  you could see other plains in and around area as well as stars. hovered about 800ft. above airport.  stopped at friends house to show them what was going on. my friend has farm 1 mile from airport. her a nd husband also witnessed and tokk pictures of event.  object was seen for about an hour. i was totally excited at what we were seeing.  i am a disabled air force veteran  and live 2miles from airport. have seen craft over airport before..  pine bush  n y  is only 10 miles from my house, wich is world known for there sightings  for which i have seen up to 12 ships at once.
content.summary: Seen object over stewart international airport. just hovering.

content.detailedDescription: It was star like but very cloudy there were no other stars in the sky
content.summary: Star like.
